text: thanks for joining us today , we 'll be back tomorrow at 08:00 .
do n't forget to keep in contact with us on facebook , twitter and email .

documents.title: nspcc warns oxfordshire children about child abuse
text: the nspcc is holding special assemblies in primary schools across oxfordshire teaching children how to stay safe from abuse
the charity says this is being held in light of recent news about children being sexually exploited in the county .
assemblies were held at st frances primary school in cowley this morning .
imogen mccabe spoke to bbc radio oxford and said educating children about abuse at a young age is vital .
author: Rahil Sheikh
BBC News Oxford

documents.title: oxford centres get £ 3.7m for cognitive research
text: doctors and medical researchers in oxford have been given £ 3.7m to continue research into mental health .

the oxford cognitive research facility , which works with hospitals and mental health service providers across the county , has been awarded the funding to continue looking at new ways of treating anxiety and mood disorders and neurological diseases like parkinson 's and alzheimer 's .
it comes after the oxford health biomedical research centre was awarded £ 12.8m for other research projects .
oxford university 's head of psychiatry dr bruno holthof said : `` this is a great result for translational neuroscience in oxford .
`` along with the awards for oxford 's brcs , the clinical research facility is fundamental to our ambitious plans for oxford neuroscience . ''

documents.title: travel latest : slow-moving traffic in oxford city centre
text: here 's the latest traffic update this evening :
author: Al Ryan
BBC Oxford travel presenter

documents.title: breakingpedestrian dies in hgv crash
text: a pedestrian has died after a crash involving a lorry in north oxfordshire .
police were called to the a423 southaam road in mollington on at on tuesday morning .
the pedestrian , a man in his 30s , died at the scene and his next of kin have been informed .
no-one has been arrested and police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: car 'flew into air ' killing four
text: car 'flew into air ' killing four

documents.title: car 'flew into air ' killing four friends
text: four people died when a car `` went into the air '' after a head-on collision in oxfordshire , a coroner has found .
sam kay , 26 , from crawley , samuel jones , 23 , 27-year-old nicoletta tocco and brogan warren , 21 , all from northampton , died from multiple injuries on the a420 in may .
toxicology reports found that mr jones , who was driving the car , had cannabis and alcohol in his bloodstream .
but the coroner said mr jones was below the drink-drive limit , and could not be sure if the level of cannabis in the driver 's system would have impaired his ability to drive .
the death was recorded as accidental .

documents.title: flooding near oxford train station
text: the road outside oxford railway station 's long-stay car park was flooded about half an hour ago .

documents.title: man , 78 , goes missing from witney overnight
text: a 78-year-old man is being sought by police after going missing from meadow lane in witney last night .
david west is 5ft 9ins , thin with short grey hair , and may be wearing a blue sweater and jeans over pyjamas and crocs-style shoes .
he is known to frequent the areas around hill park road allotments , st mary 's church and church green .
insp steve hookham , who is leading the search for david , said : we are increasingly concerned for david 's welfare .
in addition to the terrible weather conditions over the past 24 hours we believed he has not taken money with him and has left prescribed medication behind . ''
anyone who has seen david or knows of his whereabouts is asked to call 101 as a matter of urgency quoting urn 268 22/11 .

text: the old adage `` the customer is always right '' may not apply to these weird and - in some cases - impossible requests from customers at oxford hotels .
travelodge has compiled a list of strange things customers have asked for in the city of dreaming spires , including :
author: Alex Regan
South Online

documents.title: oxford lord mayor calls for changes after receiving summons
text: oxford 's lord mayor has called for council tax reminders to be sent by text message after he received a court summons for failing to pay .
mohammed altaf-khan was one of four oxfordshire councillors to be summonsed during the 2015-16 tax year .
private eye revealed the information after a freedom of information request .
oxford city council said mr altaf-khan was late paying £ 216.29 , despite being sent a demand notice and a reminder letter .
he said the unpaid council tax was for one of the properties he lets , and was overlooked after his tenants moved out .
he said : `` it was an admin error where you do n't receive the reminder or notice to pay .
`` by the time i received the summons i had paid .
i did n't go to court or anything . ''
he added : `` i think the council tax system should have text messages and emails , which are quicker and electronic . ''

documents.title: antibiotic resistance could cause 'global catastrophe '
text: oxford university innovation says if we do n't develop new antibiotics , resistance to old ones could become a global catastrophe .
researchers need to secure £ 3m in funding to develop the first new antibiotic in more than a decade to combat antibiotic resistance - which already kills 700,000 people a year .
professor mark moloney , from the team , says modern medical practice critically depends on the ability to treat infections .

documents.title: is former thames valley police boss in line to take over met ?
text: in its 187-year history , the met has never had a woman as commissioner , but this time sara thornton , head of the national police chiefs ' council , is considering applying , having steered the organisation through a difficult transition from its previous incarnation as acpo , the association of chief police officers .
thornton 's strength lies in strategy : she builds relationships , understands the world of politics , and has a vision for policing .

last year , she was heavily criticised for suggesting police no longer have the resources to visit every burglary victim and carry out random foot patrols , but the comments reflected the reality of an overstretched service .
thornton began her career in the met 30 years ago , becoming thames valley chief constable in 2007 , though her final months were clouded by the oxford grooming scandal .
a serious case review found that her force had made `` many errors '' and failed to see that children were being exploited by groups of men .
thornton said she and her officers were `` ashamed '' of the shortcomings .
author: Danny Shaw
BBC Home Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: calls made for a levy on workplace car parking in reading .
text: a controversial levy on workplace car parking is being considered by councillors trying to cut road congestion in reading .
the proposal to charge firms a fee per employee car parking space faces tough opposition from businesses .
oxfordshire county council is set to fund a study of plans to replicate a scheme in nottingham which is raising £ 9m a year for public transport .
reading green party councillor rob white thinks these are issues which should be addressed in berkshire too .
reading suffers from massive air quality problems , massive congestion problems .
the workplace parking levy would mean people who worked in the town centre would have to pay to drive into the town centre .
that money could then be used to improve public transport . ''
author: Roger Harrabin
BBC environment analyst

documents.title: flooding : 'we might have got away with it in oxfordshire '
text: oxford 's howard benthan has been talking to roving reporter lilley mitchell who is at didcot parkway this morning .
she said so far flooding has only cause minimal disruption on the railways , with no cancellations reported in oxfordshire .
howard said : `` it looks like we might have got away with it in oxfordshire . ''
author: Howard Bentham
Radio Oxford presenter

between swindon and bristol parkway this morning due to flooding and heavy rain .
author: BBC Travel
